title: Your unwritten rules for climbing in ranked.
body:
Thought this would be a fun post to see what everyone's unwritten rules are with ranked. 

One of my rules is that if someone dodges a lobby I would rather wait 5-10 minutes, even up to half an hour even before I start another lobby because I was losing every game where I got matched into a second lobby to the point where I actually noticed a pattern.  I literally mean every game, every time!  Extra salt points for when I noticed the enemy team was actually my first lobby and / or every one on my team feeds to high hell. XD 

Anyone else have a rule or a set of rules they follow when playing ranked?

replies.body:
* Focus on self
* When people are arguing with each other I type "Don't talk, just play" twice. If they continue I mute them both.
* DO NOT AUTOPILOT (always be thinking and reviewing actions in game - Why was I there, what information did I take in, and what assumptions did I make?, what information did I miss?)
* I always do 10 minutes of exercise (usually push ups, squats and water break) in between losses.

I don't have rules for climbing, because I don't care about that, but I do have rules for playing ranked. I play an aram before my first queue of the day as a warmup and also to make sure my ping is okay. Then when I enter a ranked game, /mute all immediately.

LOL I used to mute people at the start of the game every time too!  Worked great in bronze.  It's great to do it when you're on tilt because there's nothing you can really say that'll be helpful.  You generally just want everyone to stop being stupid and you'll most likely tell them so!

Always be positive. Never respond to negativity with negativity. As a support main, the brunt of the teams flame is often aimed at myself, even if my marksmen and I are doing well, if someone starts flaming the support, and the support responds with either nothing, or something innocent and light hearted suddenly the flamer looks like a massive twat, and you aren't a bad person. :)

this speaks to me on a spiritual level as another support/fill main. Also it's really funny when the jungler is being toxic and isn't ganking and the toplaner is complaining about never getting a gank, and so you wait till both botlanes need to back and then you fake a back and then run full speed to another lane to do a support gank and it tilts the enemy team to a whole other dimension. 

I remember ganking toplane as mobi boots janna a few months ago, popping a shield in a clutch fight, exhausting, slowing and then knocking up the enemy toplaner and they died and swore in allchat about why the hell was janna toplane and like 10s later they just disconnected in what i assume was some sort of coincidence.

Just the other day, our Malphite and Syndra swapped lanes to deal with a top lane teemo and a mid lane Zed. My marksmen wanted to back and I only had 650 gold and didn't want to back till I could get my sightstone.

I roamed mid and sat in the bot side brush. Our mid lane malphite just started spam pinging me, over and over and over again, then Zed decided to move up the lane and make a try for malphite, so I burst forth from my brush with an E-Q-W, Zed began to back off, fearing the combined force of Malphite and Sona... but then Malphite disengaged, and I had to burn my flash to escape with my life.

Malphite: f'ing noob support, just stay in your own f'ing lane and stop ruining my lane.
Ezreal: Sona wtf? why did you go mid that's just stupid?
Sona: :)

aww that sucks, well hopefully you won't be discouraged from support roams because it's one of the greatest highlights of playing support outside of sick engages/disengage during lategame teamfighting.
Wow my heart sinks just thinking about it!

Maybe once I get out of bronze, I'm often being ordered to return to my marksmen as if they are the only reason I exist.
It's like, bruv, I already put 20 minutes into that fat, disrespectful child, and my efforts have lead to him being fed af. It's not my fault he roams the enemy jungle while I'm helping out our laners.
Few things bother me as much as getting flamed when you're only trying to be helpful.

It's all worth it for that one marksmen in ten that actually understands the game.

ban whoever counters you, not whose op, screw everyone else until 10 ban system

**- ** Play a game of flex or normal before ranked to ready your reflexes
**-** Don't play with cold hands, your reflexes will be slower
**-** Don't just walk to lane and alt tab till lane starts, gain vision from brushes and look for potential picks if your team has adequate cc
**- ** Always hover your champion in champ select, especially if you play picks that're considered OP, as they are likely to be banned
**-** Don't be afraid to dodge, in the long run you gain more lp. Dodge if you think your team is looking weak or you're all one type of damage (full ap/ad) 
**-** Create a flexible champion pool, this will ensure that if anything you can work around your team yourself, in terms of composition
**-** After each game take a break, regardless of the outcome.
**-** Stay positive and motivate your team, "We can win this guys" etc, if someone is being overly cynical mute the individual to not be tilted yourself.

* Never Surrender, always play it out.

* Focus on yourself.

* Always do your best.

* Don't waste time typing.

My second rule in ranked.  If no one picks or bans Darius and enemy team gets him, I dodge!  

After his small nerf I did Jungle Vi game and started the enemy red... ganked Darius at level 1 thinking he won't be THAT dangerous level 1 anymore... (I put a point in W and Q so this is kind of my fault LOL) but I bust his flash first gank. Then, I looped around and came back for another gank almost immediately when he went back for CS.  It was a smart return gank to make on any other top lane opponent I think, but not Darius.  He got a double kill somehow and since then he has been permabanned in every game I play.  Don't believe me?  Look at my match history for ranked games and you'll see he's banned every game. LOL

Shit, just seeing that guy get picked tilts me.  I literally have Vietnam flashbacks if I see him in my games haha!
i used to have trouble against him but now i just play heimer into him.... by the time you have 5 points in q and 30% cdr its funny as fuck.

using the forward point illuminati formation? the double forward point formation? rotated illuminati formation or just 3 in a cluster formation? I tend to go for forward point or rotated formations vs darius but I'm curious as they each have their pros and cons, I prefer rotated point since it makes freezing the minion wave at optimum range around your turrets a little easier.

Reflecting on this thread I don't have any rules in regards to climbing. Why? because it's all about luck and who you get paired with. Roll the dice each game, 50/50 chance whether or not you get retards on your team.
